page.title: 10Charing High Street.
page.content: If you walk down Charing High Street you will see a number of shops. There are two butchers, a newsagents, a Post Office and two supermarkets as well as a greengrocers, an ironmongers and a small electrical shop. Over the years Charing has lost various shops such as the chemist, a grocers, a toy shop, a drapers, a shoe shop and a shop that sold fish, fruit and berries. This is mainiy because the people that owned them couldn't afford to run them any more because people bought their food and other goods from big supermarkets in towns like Canterbury, Maidstone and Ashford. Some shops have been replaced by offices in recent years, for example two estate agents, a solicitor's, an accountant's, two banks and two building society offices.
